speaker: Third Outlaw
text_entry: SCENE II. Milan. Outside the DUKE's palace, under SILVIA's chamber.

speaker: Third Outlaw
text_entry: Enter PROTEUS

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Already have I been false to Valentine

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: And now I must be as unjust to Thurio.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Under the colour of commending him,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: I have access my own love to prefer:

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: But Silvia is too fair, too true, too holy,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: To be corrupted with my worthless gifts.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: When I protest true loyalty to her,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: She twits me with my falsehood to my friend;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: When to her beauty I commend my vows,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: She bids me think how I have been forsworn

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: In breaking faith with Julia whom I loved:

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: And notwithstanding all her sudden quips,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: The least whereof would quell a lover's hope,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Yet, spaniel-like, the more she spurns my love,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: The more it grows and fawneth on her still.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: But here comes Thurio: now must we to her window,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: And give some evening music to her ear.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Enter THURIO and Musicians

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: How now, Sir Proteus, are you crept before us?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Ay, gentle Thurio: for you know that love

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Will creep in service where it cannot go.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Ay, but I hope, sir, that you love not here.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Sir, but I do; or else I would be hence.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Who? Silvia?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Ay, Silvia; for your sake.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: I thank you for your own. Now, gentlemen,

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Let's tune, and to it lustily awhile.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Enter, at a distance, Host, and JULIA in boy's clothes

speaker: Host
text_entry: Now, my young guest, methinks you're allycholly: I

speaker: Host
text_entry: pray you, why is it?

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Marry, mine host, because I cannot be merry.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Come, we'll have you merry: I'll bring you where

speaker: Host
text_entry: you shall hear music and see the gentleman that you asked for.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: But shall I hear him speak?

speaker: Host
text_entry: Ay, that you shall.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: That will be music.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Music plays

speaker: Host
text_entry: Hark, hark!

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Is he among these?

speaker: Host
text_entry: Ay: but, peace! let's hear 'em.

speaker: Host
text_entry: SONG.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Who is Silvia? what is she,

speaker: Host
text_entry: That all our swains commend her?

speaker: Host
text_entry: Holy, fair and wise is she;

speaker: Host
text_entry: The heaven such grace did lend her,

speaker: Host
text_entry: That she might admired be.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Is she kind as she is fair?

speaker: Host
text_entry: For beauty lives with kindness.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Love doth to her eyes repair,

speaker: Host
text_entry: To help him of his blindness,

speaker: Host
text_entry: And, being help'd, inhabits there.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Then to Silvia let us sing,

speaker: Host
text_entry: That Silvia is excelling;

speaker: Host
text_entry: She excels each mortal thing

speaker: Host
text_entry: Upon the dull earth dwelling:

speaker: Host
text_entry: To her let us garlands bring.

speaker: Host
text_entry: How now! are you sadder than you were before? How

speaker: Host
text_entry: do you, man? the music likes you not.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: You mistake; the musician likes me not.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Why, my pretty youth?

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: He plays false, father.

speaker: Host
text_entry: How? out of tune on the strings?

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Not so; but yet so false that he grieves my very

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: heart-strings.

speaker: Host
text_entry: You have a quick ear.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Ay, I would I were deaf; it makes me have a slow heart.

speaker: Host
text_entry: I perceive you delight not in music.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Not a whit, when it jars so.

speaker: Host
text_entry: Hark, what fine change is in the music!

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Ay, that change is the spite.

speaker: Host
text_entry: You would have them always play but one thing?

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: I would always have one play but one thing.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: But, host, doth this Sir Proteus that we talk on

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Often resort unto this gentlewoman?

speaker: Host
text_entry: I tell you what Launce, his man, told me: he loved

speaker: Host
text_entry: her out of all nick.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Where is Launce?

speaker: Host
text_entry: Gone to seek his dog; which tomorrow, by his

speaker: Host
text_entry: master's command, he must carry for a present to his lady.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Peace! stand aside: the company parts.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Sir Thurio, fear not you: I will so plead

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: That you shall say my cunning drift excels.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Where meet we?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: At Saint Gregory's well.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Farewell.

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Exeunt THURIO and Musicians

speaker: THURIO
text_entry: Enter SILVIA above

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Madam, good even to your ladyship.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: I thank you for your music, gentlemen.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Who is that that spake?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: One, lady, if you knew his pure heart's truth,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: You would quickly learn to know him by his voice.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Sir Proteus, as I take it.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Sir Proteus, gentle lady, and your servant.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: What's your will?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: That I may compass yours.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: You have your wish; my will is even this:

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: That presently you hie you home to bed.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Thou subtle, perjured, false, disloyal man!

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Think'st thou I am so shallow, so conceitless,

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: To be seduced by thy flattery,

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: That hast deceived so many with thy vows?

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Return, return, and make thy love amends.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: For me, by this pale queen of night I swear,

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: I am so far from granting thy request

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: That I despise thee for thy wrongful suit,

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: And by and by intend to chide myself

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Even for this time I spend in talking to thee.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: I grant, sweet love, that I did love a lady;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: But she is dead.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: [Aside]        'Twere false, if I should speak it;

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: For I am sure she is not buried.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Say that she be; yet Valentine thy friend

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Survives; to whom, thyself art witness,

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: I am betroth'd: and art thou not ashamed

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: To wrong him with thy importunacy?

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: I likewise hear that Valentine is dead.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: And so suppose am I; for in his grave

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Assure thyself my love is buried.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Sweet lady, let me rake it from the earth.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Go to thy lady's grave and call hers thence,

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Or, at the least, in hers sepulchre thine.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: [Aside]  He heard not that.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Madam, if your heart be so obdurate,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Vouchsafe me yet your picture for my love,

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: The picture that is hanging in your chamber;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: To that I'll speak, to that I'll sigh and weep:

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: For since the substance of your perfect self

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Is else devoted, I am but a shadow;

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: And to your shadow will I make true love.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: [Aside]  If 'twere a substance, you would, sure,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: deceive it,

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: And make it but a shadow, as I am.

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: I am very loath to be your idol, sir;

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: But since your falsehood shall become you well

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: To worship shadows and adore false shapes,

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: Send to me in the morning and I'll send it:

speaker: SILVIA
text_entry: And so, good rest.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: As wretches have o'ernight

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: That wait for execution in the morn.

speaker: PROTEUS
text_entry: Exeunt PROTEUS and SILVIA severally

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Host, will you go?

speaker: Host
text_entry: By my halidom, I was fast asleep.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Pray you, where lies Sir Proteus?

speaker: Host
text_entry: Marry, at my house. Trust me, I think 'tis almost

speaker: Host
text_entry: day.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Not so; but it hath been the longest night

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: That e'er I watch'd and the most heaviest.

speaker: JULIA
text_entry: Exeunt
